item.title: French Authorities Investigate Death of Streamer Jean Pormanove After Months of Abuse
item.description: Raphaël Graven, known online as Jean Pormanove, was regularly subjected to humiliation and abuse on Kick, a streaming platform.

item.title: Israel’s Operation to Take Control of Gaza City Looms. Where Does It Stand?
item.description: The Israeli government is expanding its operation in Gaza, despite its generals’ advice and as it deliberates on a new cease-fire proposal.

item.title: Europe Gets a Written Trump Trade Deal, With a Caveat for Automakers
item.description: Under the newly fleshed-out details, Washington will maintain high tariffs on vehicles imported from the bloc until the E.U. takes steps to lower its ...

item.title: Analysis: What Progress Has Trump Really Made in Ukraine Peace Talks?
item.description: Nearly a week after President Trump’s Alaska summit, his suggestions of imminent breakthroughs have not come to pass.

item.title: Facing a ‘Reading Crisis,’ Denmark Wants to Make Books Cheaper
item.description: The Danish government announced this week that it planned to make books exempt from a 25 percent value-added tax.
